title: Production deployment documentation for Internet Computer mainnet (DFX)

requirements.summary: Expand `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md` into a complete, copy/paste-ready mainnet deployment guide with Stripe admin configuration instructions, verification checklist, and rollback notes.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md` contains a complete, copy/paste-ready sequence of commands to deploy to `--network ic`, with no placeholder or truncated sections.

The guide includes explicit steps for: selecting the correct DFX identity, ensuring the correct canister IDs are used for production, deploying backend and frontend assets, and confirming the app loads successfully on mainnet.

The guide documents how an admin configures Stripe in production (including where/how to call the backend method that sets Stripe configuration) and notes that the operation requires admin permissions.

The guide includes a post-deploy verification checklist covering at minimum: Internet Identity login/logout, landing page load, invoice creation + PDF export, pricing page checkout session creation, and payment success/failure routes.
The guide includes a rollback/redeploy note describing how to redeploy a previous known-good build (high-level, using DFX) if the production publish fails.

file_operations.description: Replace the current truncated content with a complete production deployment document for deploying to the IC mainnet via DFX. Include: (1) prerequisites and safety checks, (2) identity selection and verification, (3) confirming production canister IDs are correct for `--network ic`, (4) copy/paste-ready commands to deploy backend + frontend assets to mainnet, (5) how to verify the deployed app loads, (6) Stripe production configuration instructions that explicitly reference calling the backend method `setStripeConfiguration(...)` and clearly note it is admin-only (authorization/role-based access control), (7) a post-deploy verification checklist covering Internet Identity login/logout, landing page, invoice creation + PDF export, pricing checkout session creation, and payment success/failure routes, and (8) a rollback/redeploy note for returning to a previous known-good build using DFX at a high level. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
